list_definition.definition: to press (something) together or from all sides tightly

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He squeezed the clay into a ball.

list_definition.definition: to force (eg oneself) eg into or through a narrow space

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The dog squeezed himself / his body into the hole
We were all squeezed into the back seat of the car.

list_definition.definition: to force something, eg liquid, out of something by pressing

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She squeezed the oranges (into a jug)
We might be able to squeeze some more money/information out of him.
He gave his sister an affectionate squeeze.
We all got into the car, but it was a squeeze.

list_definition.mean_english: một chút gì do vắt ra
list_definition.definition: a few drops produced by squeezing

list_definition.mean_english: sự hạn chế về tài chính

list_ex_of_english: The fluid was squeezed from the swab into the stomacher bag or poured into a sterile test tube.
Where necessary, contents of the body cavity were squeezed out using a fine forceps.
A major proportion of the time in a copulation is spent squeezing the female (mean was 52+18%).
Financially squeezed by the depression of the 1880s, they began to accept paying patients.
If you keep squeezing harder and harder, at some point the seed will fly out.
Figure 2 shows the stretching and squeezing modes.
The gut contents from each section were squeezed out, weighed and an egg count carried out on each section.
In both experiments of multiple resurrection and reproduction, the vitality of the animals was squeezed out, reaching complete exhaustion.
